Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.koloskov.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.koloskov.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements JarImpler
A class that generates implementations of Java interfaces and abstract classes.

This class implements JarImpler and Impler. Class can generate a Java source file with an implementation of a given abstract class or interface. Additionally, it supports compiling the generated code and packaging it into a JAR file.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main entry point of the application.

      Depending on the command-line arguments, this method generates either a Java implementation file or a JAR file with the compiled implementation. If the -jar flag is provided, a JAR file will be created; otherwise, a regular implementation file will be generated.

      Note: The order of the arguments matters. The -jar flag, if used, must be the first argument. Generated class' name will be the same as the class name of the type token with the Impl suffix added.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments:
      • -jar: Optional flag to create a JAR file.
      • <class>: Type token of the class or interface type to implement.
      • <path>: The root directory for the generated file or JAR.

    • validateArgs

      private static boolean validateArgs(String[] args)
      Validates the command-line arguments for the program.

      If args contains null or have less or more arguments, it will be written to stderr and return boolean flag

      Parameters:
      args - the arguments to validate
      Returns:
      true if the arguments are valid, otherwise false

    • addClassToJar

      private static void addClassToJar(Path classFile, Path rootDirectory, JarOutputStream jarOutputStream)
      Adds a compiled class file to the specified JAR archive.

      This helper function is used to add a single class file to an existing JAR archive. The class file is added relative to the rootDirectory and its path in the JAR will reflect the directory structure relative to this root.

      Parameters:
      classFile - the path to the compiled class file to add to the JAR
      rootDirectory - the root directory containing the compiled class files
      jarOutputStream - the output stream of the JAR file to which the class file will be added
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException - if an IOException occurs during the file copy or while interacting with the jarOutputStream, the exception is wrapped into an unchecked exception.

    • getManifest

      private static Manifest getManifest()
      Generates a default manifest for the JAR file.

      This method creates a new Manifest object and sets the MANIFEST_VERSION attribute to "1.0". The generated manifest can be used when creating a JAR file.

      Returns:
      a default Manifest

    • compile

      private static void compile(Class<?> clazz, Path path) throws ImplerException
      Compiles the generated implementation source file into a class file.

      This method uses the system's Java compiler to compile the generated source file that implements the specified class or interface. It adds the directory containing the generated source file to the classpath.

      Parameters:
      clazz - the class or interface being implemented
      path - the directory containing the generated source file
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the compilation fails, or if the Java compiler is not available

    • createDirectories

      private static void createDirectories(Path path) throws ImplerException
      Creates the necessary directories for the given path if they do not already exist.

      This method ensures that all parent directories of the specified path are created. If the directories already exist, the method does nothing. If any error occurs during directory creation, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      path - the path for which directories should be created
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if an error occurs while creating directories

    • createTempDirectory

      private static Path createTempDirectory(Path path) throws ImplerException
      Creates a temporary directory inside the specified base path.

      The temporary directory will be created in the parent directory of the given path and will have a prefix of "temp".

      Parameters:
      path - the path where the temporary directory should be created
      Returns:
      the path to the created temporary directory
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if the directory cannot be created

    • getImplFilePath

      private static Path getImplFilePath(Class<?> clazz, Path path)
      Generates the file path for the implementation of the given class.

      The implementation java file will be placed in the corresponding package directory within the specified root directory, with the class name suffixed by "Impl".

      Parameters:
      clazz - the class to implement
      path - the root directory where the implementation file should be placed
      Returns:
      the path to the generated implementation file

    • getPackagePath

      private static Path getPackagePath(Class<?> clazz)
      Returns the package path for the given class.

      The package name of the class is converted into a corresponding directory path, where each package segment is separated by the file system's separator.

      Parameters:
      clazz - the class whose package path should be determined
      Returns:
      the package path as a Path, corresponding to the directory structure

    • clearPath

      private static void clearPath(Path path)
      Recursively deletes files and directories at the specified path.

      This method walks through the given path, including all subdirectories and files, and deletes them in reverse order to avoid issues when deleting directories. Any errors encountered during the deletion are logged to System.err.

      Parameters:
      path - the path to delete, including subdirectories and files

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> clazz, Path path) throws ImplerException
      Generates a Java source file implementing the specified class or interface.

      This method generates the implementation for the given class or interface and writes it to the specified directory. The implementation will be placed in the corresponding file with the appropriate suffix, such as ClassNameImpl.java.

      NOTE: throws as cause of ImplerException IOException if an I/O error occurs during file creation or writing

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      clazz - type token of the class or interface to implement
      path - the root directory where the implementation file should be placed
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if an error occurs while generating the implementation or writing to the file

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> clazz, Path jarPath) throws ImplerException
      Generates a JAR file containing a compiled implementation of the given class or interface.

      This method generates the Java source code for the specified class or interface, compiles it, and packages the compiled class into a JAR file at the specified location.

      NOTE: throws as cause of ImplerException IOException if an I/O error occurs during file creation or copying

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      clazz - type token of the class or interface to implement
      jarPath - the path where the JAR file should be created
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if an error occurs during implementation generation, compilation, or packaging

    • packageIntoJar

      private void packageIntoJar(Class<?> clazz, Path jarPath, Path tempDirectory) throws ImplerException
      Creates a JAR file containing the compiled implementation of a class.

      This method packages the compiled class files of the specified class into a JAR file at the provided output path. It adds all class files from the temporary directory to the JAR file, ensuring the correct package structure.

      NOTE: throws as cause of ImplerException IOException if an I/O error occurs during file operations

      Parameters:
      clazz - the implemented class
      jarPath - the output path for the JAR file
      tempDirectory - the directory containing compiled class files
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if an error occurs while writing the JAR file or adding class files to it
